Package orientationStructures

Class SparseGraphDataPreparer

java.lang.Object
orientationStructures.SparseGraphDataPreparer
Direct Known Subclasses:
DirectedToNNDigraph, UndirectedToNNDigraph
public abstract class SparseGraphDataPreparer extends Object
Contains common methods of the classes DirectedToNNDigraph and UndirectedToNNDigraph, such as building a vertex index, but no graphs are built yet. The two core construction occurs with a generic AbstractGraph as parameter.
Author:
R. W. R. Darling

    • setSourceTargetWeightList

      public void setSourceTargetWeightList(List<StringPairWithWeight> edgeRecords)
      First method to invoke.
      Parameters:
      edgeRecords - list of "source, target, weight" triples. In extensions of this abstract class, edges will be declared as directed or undirected.

    • buildObjectIndex

      public void buildObjectIndex()
      Build an index for all the source and target strings, which refer to vertices.

      WARNING: Not enough to include sources only. Possibly some vertex has out-degree zero, but positive in-degree.

      Preparation for making a linkageGraph with vertices indexed by integers 0 to n − 1

    • buildEdgeList

      public List<org.jgrapht.alg.util.Triple<Integer,Integer,Double>> buildEdgeList()
      Returns:
      list of triples suitable for input file for the SparseIntDirectedWeightedGraph constructor.

    • determineTwoCore

      public void determineTwoCore(org.jgrapht.graph.AbstractGraph<Integer,Integer> abstractGraph)
      Construct lists of edges and vertices outside the two core, without regards to whether edges are directed or not.
      Parameters:
      abstractGraph - will be a SparseIntDirectedWeightedGraph or SparseIntUndirectedWeightedGraph in an extending class.
